The A≈ø≈øe, hoping to finde and fare the better for his freene≈ø≈øe: Indeed, ≈øaith hee, my good Fathers, there is one thing much troubleth my con≈øcience, and lyes full heauy vpon my heart; On a time, a certaine Pilgrime in going to Rome, chanced to lye in our Stable,
